article.title: GridSphere Frequently Asked Questions
article.para: This section contains a few Q's and A's on installing and configuring GridSphere

question.para: I'm using JDK 1.4.1 and when the build script tries to build the docbook target it fails with: [style] : Fatal Error! org.apache.xml.dtm.DTMException: No more DTM IDs are available Cause: org.apache.xml.dtm.DTMException: No more DTM IDs are available

answer.para: For some reason the version of Xalan shipped with JDK1.4.1 has some bugs. The recommended solution is to copy xalan.jar from lib/ext in the GridSphere source to $JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/endorsed.

question.para: Why is it called GridSphere-- I don't see anything Grid related in it!

answer.para: In our first release of GridSphere we have developed a portal framework based upon the portlet API. To provide greater reusability and flexibility, it was decided to not require any Grid services for the proper functioning of the GridSphere portlet container. However, we are currently developing many fundamental Grid portlets that will showcase GridLab and OGSA services.
